% Yeah ! I'm using \makeatletter and \makeatother !
% Yeah ! I'm using \expandafter and \(end)csname !
% TeX level ++

\usepackage{abbrevs}

% This only evaluates \@#1.
\newcommand{\ERS}[1]{%
\expandafter\csname @#1\endcsname%
}

\newcommand{\ERSlong}[1]{%
\expandafter\csname @#1long\endcsname%
}

\newcommand{\ERSshort}[1]{%
\expandafter\csname @#1short\endcsname%
}


\makeatletter
% Formatting.
\newcommand{\@ersprint}[2]{\textbf{#1}}
\newcommand{\@ersprintlong}[2]{\textbf{#1} (#2)}

% \newabbrev\toto{Toto long}[Toto short] is more or less a \def.
% Stuff around to allow command name with spaces.
\newcommand{\@ersline}[2]{%
\expandafter\newabbrev\csname @#1\endcsname{\@ersprintlong{#2}{#1}}[\@ersprint{#2}{#1}]%
}

%%%%%%%%%% Usage %%%%%%%%%%%%
%
% \@ersline{Gross income B}{B26} => creates an abbrev.
%
% \ERS{Gross income B}   =>  prints "B26".

% For compatibility and memory.
%\newcommand\lignebudget[1]{line~#1 of \EcoRS}

% The \ERS command somehow adds a space after it, which is doubled if there is
% another one here (???) So, no space before "of".
\newcommand\lignebudget[1]{line~\ERS{#1}of \EcoRS}
\newcommand\lignebudgetlong[1]{line~\ERSlong{#1}of \EcoRS}
